description: The closest intersecting street: beech | How is the car parked illegally? Other | Details: The parking issues exist on both Nikisch and Beech streets. General parking problems, due in part to possibly illegal renting/overcrowding (see separate complaint regarding 281 beech st) Residents and visitors regularly park cars too close together which prevents other residents from both parking near their own home and being able to move their car out of a legal spot. Often the parking is so congested that people routinely block fire hydrants and ignore the 20 foot distance from curb (for fire apparatus) access. In addition, residents routinely park facing the wrong way (on Nikisch st - against the oncoming traffic.) This has been a serious problem for a long time. I have lived here for 14 years and witnessed many accidents, near accidents and confrontations between drivers. Nikisch is wide enough for parking on both sides, however due to the fact that the street is regulary used as a short cut to avoid washington st, the traffic on this street is very busy which causes other problems as well.
address: Intersection of Beech St and Nikisch Ave, Roslindale, MA

description: The closest intersecting street: Tremont Street | How is the car parked illegally? Double parked | Details: Topic: smooth flow of traffic at a major downtown location, Stuart St at Tremont St, particularly during rush hour; illegal parking done (for years) with the assistance of W Hotel valet parking folks. I have driven by this location most weekday mornings since 2008, usually 7:30-9 am. Very often, perhaps a third of the time, there are cars parked illegally in front of W Hotel. This morning, at 10 am sharp, there were three! At the curb, the full block's length in front of the hotel, there is a lane for parking and taxis; no complaint about that. The next lane away from the curb is a full traffic lane. Often, there are cars double-parked in this full traffic lane. Sometimes, the parking/cab lane is full, so they permit double-parking; however, it remains illegal and improper. W Hotel may need more quickly to valet park (elsewhere) the cars that are taking up parking space in the parking lane, so they have more open spots (or ask drivers to circle the block). Cars are double-parked not simply for a few seconds, but often for many minutes. That is selfish, improper, illegal and unsafe. Traffic is forced to merge a full lane to the left around the double-parked cars, and then immediately back to the right since the traffic lane is by then a "right turn only" lane. Other times, double-parking goes on even when there IS space in the parking/cab lane! It seems the valet personnel allow this simply to make it luxurious for whoever was driving to hop out of his or her car fast. This more flagrant violation is even more egregious. In just 10 minutes (around 11:10 am, 8 August 2012), I took the three submitted photos. In the first two, there are two different W Hotel valet personnel helping/assisting drivers to double-park in the traffic lane. In the final photo, there are two double-parked cars in the traffic lane alongside several available parking spaces in the parking lane. THANK YOU for caring about smooth flow of traffic in Boston!!!

status_notes: Case Closed. Case Noted. The Boston Transportation does not allocate parking spaces for any city employee personal use.  Although we understand the frustration of trying to find parking we have worked with Charlestown High in accomodating short term parking for the school.
description: The closest intersecting street: Monument Way | How is the car parked illegally? Resident parking spot | Details: I am NOT here to submit a parking lot violation, but this is the closest thing I could find. I am here to complain about the fact that Charlestown High School staff have been provided with an insufficient number of parking spaces, and as a result, some of us are ticketed. Teachers are issued permits for 3 parking lots – 1 parking lot behind the Charlestown Community Center, and 2 parking lots off of Walford Way, in the Charlestown BHA development. These parking arrangements were made with the city because the city knows that there is not enough designated parking for the staff at CHS, and even those arrangements are not enough – and the city must know this, because they have records of how many staff work at CHS and how many spaces are in each lot. This is a problem of city employees that the city is solving on paper but not in reality. These lots are not exclusively reserved for teachers - they are shared with Charlestown residents - and every day, they are full. Behind the community center, the lot fills past capacity every day, with at least 7 cars squeezing into strips of pavement not designated as parking spaces. Any day that I am able to claim one of these spaces, I do so knowing that I am displacing one colleague who will have to park outside our designated area and risk being fined for parking at work. Sometimes, I am the displaced one, and I'll wave to other teachers who are in the same boat for the day, parking on Medford Street as I’m getting out of my own Medford Street space. And we are receiving tickets. I have received 5 tickets already this year - that's $100 I'm being asked to pay for 5 days of parking. This is ridiculous. We are not hotshots demanding to park wherever we please: we just need to get to park at work without worrying about paying $20 a day for parking - that's $3600 for a 180-day school year - even when the city has not provided us with enough spaces. | Type of vehicle: Car | Details: Please see above. I am not writing to report illegal parking. I am writing to complain about unacceptable parking allotments for City employees at Charlestown High School | Make: Acura | Model: 2DR | Color: Black | Vehicle License Plate State: MA
